head.citation-title: Efficient iterative method for generalized Sylvester quaternion tensor equation
head.abstracts: © 2023, The Author(s) under exclusive licence to Sociedade Brasileira de Matemática Aplicada e Computacional.In this study, we employ the biconjugate residual (BCR) algorithm in tensor form to deal with the generalized Sylvester quaternion tensor equation in order to find the minimum norm solution. The proposed algorithm uses only tensor format. It can be proved that the proposed approach can find the solution with in a finite number of steps in the absence of round-off errors. Furthermore, we can get the unique minimal Frobenius norm solution by choosing special kinds of initial tensor. Finally, some numerical examples are reported to illustrate the feasibility of our algorithm, including the effectiveness of the algorithm in color video restoration problems.

organization.$: Center for Applied Mathematics of Fujian Province (FJNU)

affiliation.ce:source-text: Center for Applied Mathematics of Fujian Province (FJNU), Fuzhou, 350117, People’s Republic of China

grant-text.$: The authors are grateful for the Editor-in-Chief, Associate Editor, and Reviewers for their valuable comments and insightful suggestions that helped to improve this research significantly. coredata.dc:description: In this study, we employ the biconjugate residual (BCR) algorithm in tensor form to deal with the generalized Sylvester quaternion tensor equation in order to find the minimum norm solution. The proposed algorithm uses only tensor format. It can be proved that the proposed approach can find the solution with in a finite number of steps in the absence of round-off errors. Furthermore, we can get the unique minimal Frobenius norm solution by choosing special kinds of initial tensor. Finally, some numerical examples are reported to illustrate the feasibility of our algorithm, including the effectiveness of the algorithm in color video restoration problems.
